intro: Mesadenia rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf mesadenia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, rounded leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it may be considered invasive in some areas.
